titleStmt.title: Letter from Ptolemaios to Kassianos Gemellos
titleStmt.author: Ptolemaios

revisionDesc.change: Pull translation out of APIS record.

div.ab: Ptolemaios to Kassianos, his brother, very many greetings. Before anything else I pary for your health. I have received one keramion --- and a letter in which you write that you had come ---. At the same time you could have come up-country to us so that we too --- because it is sweet to greet you in person. If he wants you to come in good health another time I implore you to come up-country to me. If I find someone who can bring you Proklous (Proclus)'s money I will send it through him, if not, if Longinos (Longinus) has not departed, you will speak to him with my words and you will take it from him and write to me through him and I will give him here hundred and twenty-four drachmas. Greet Sarapias and her mother and Baukalas and all your people, each by name. I pray for your health, lord. Mecheir 17.

listBibl.bibl: GHR Horsley, New Documents Illustrating Early Christianity. Papyri 1977., no 20. -- BL IX 374 (line 5) Sijpesteijn PJ , PWisc II, 71, 1977, Plate XXVI Boswinkel - Sijpesteijn, Greek Papyri, recto, pl. 26
